text: is it possible to display a certain row of a HubDB table? i have {{row.name}} but i need something like {{row27.name}}  ( for row number 27 of my name column)...
`hubdb_table_row()`
thanks Matt!
Should be in <https://designers.HubSpot.com/en/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-functions>
found it!
Can I use a hubl variable to define a module path, and what's the syntax to do that? The following isn't working for me: ```  {% module "module_155182581178173" path=ENV.headerPath %}```
Unfortunately right now you will have to surround the variable in `{{ }}`
`path="{{ ENV.headerPath }}"`
I am working on fixing this
Beautiful! thank you
I’m trying to add a class to the body tag based on the page title. I tried adding {{ page_meta.name }} to the template Body Classes field in Design Manager, but that didn’t work. Any Ideas?
Are you using a drag n drop template or a coded template?
drag n drop
I’m trying to apply different styles based on the page. Without creating a new template for each one.
I don't think you'd be able to do that with drag n drop, the body classes field can't accept hubl code. You'd need to use a coded template or apply the class using javascript
That’s what I thought. I’ve got a couple other ideas to get it done. Thanks!

I have a custom-coded (HTML/Hubl) template that my client would like to be able to add new modules to. However, the option to add modules on the front-end is missing for this template. What do I need to do to the template in order to give the client the ability to add any module from the module library from the front-end?
I think front end users can only add/remove modules from within a flexible column

<@UGCPXTKMW> Thanks for the reply! I found this note in the documentation on the flex column topic, confirming your answer: Please note: you can only add new modules into areas on the page that utilize flexible columns. If you notice you are not able to drop the module in a particular area, it is because that area may not be part of the flexible column on your template.
really appreciate it!!
